question.body: What energetic interactions are responsible for membrane formation from lipids?

response.feedback: Incorrect. Hydrogen bonding stabilizes structures in hydrophilic regions.
Correct. The membrane interior is hydrophobic and it ‘attracts’ hydrophobic materials within it.
Incorrect. Lipids have covalent bonds between atoms, but the lipids within membranes are not covalently bonded. That’s why membranes can have dramatic reorganization, as we will cover later.
Incorrect. Ionic interactions only happen in hydrophilic areas.

part.hint: Recall that phospholipids have both a hydrophilic end and a hydrophobic end.
Lipids assemble into membranes, reducing the exposure of the tail domains to intracellular or extracellular fluid.
